qas.question: How many regions in Singapore have widely accepted madaris?
What law protects the teaching of Arabic and Islamic traditions in Mindanao?
What religion do most people practice in Mindanao?
What curriculum is used in non public madaris in Mindanao?
When did madaris become more accepted in Mindanao?
How many regions outside of Singapore have widely accepted madaris?
What law does not protect the teaching of Arabic and Islamic traditions in Mindanao?
What religion does nobody practice in Mindanao?
What curriculum is used in public madaris in Mindanao?
When did madaris become less accepted in Mindanao?

context: In <a4_0><b9_0>2004<b9_0/><a4_0/>, madaris were mainstreamed in <a0_0><b5_0>16<b5_0/><a0_0/> Regions nationwide, primarily in <a2_0>Muslim<a2_0/>-majority areas in Mindanao under the auspices of the Department of Education (DepEd). The DepEd adopted <a1_0><b6_0>Department Order No. 51<b6_0/><a1_0/>, which instituted Arabic-language and Islamic Values instruction for <b7_0><b8_0>Muslim<b8_0/><b7_0/> children in state schools, and authorised implementation of the <a3_0>Standard Madrasa Curriculum (SMC)<a3_0/> in private-run madaris. While there are state-recognised Islamic schools, such as Ibn Siena Integrated School in the Islamic City of Marawi, Sarang Bangun LC in Zamboanga and SMIE in Jolo, their Islamic studies programmes initially varied in application and content.
